title: Client A — Retail & Wholesale Digitization
summary: Built end‑to‑end operational infrastructure for a retail/wholesale business: B2C storefront, B2B portal, CRM, invoicing, inventory sync, and shipping integration. Reduced manual work ~80% and enabled 10× order capacity.
body:
Outcomes

  • ~80% reduction in manual admin
  • 10× order capacity readiness
  • Unified reporting across B2C/B2B
diagram:
graph TD
  B2C[Shopfront (B2C)] --> CRM[CRM]
  B2B[B2B Portal] --> CRM
  CRM --> INV[Inventory]
  CRM --> ACC[Accounting]
  CRM --> SHIP[Shipping]
  ACC --> REPORTS[Reports]
  subgraph Platforms
    B2C
    B2B
    CRM
    INV
    ACC
    SHIP
  end

title: Client B — Coaching/Community Platform Systems
summary: Re‑architected site structure and community flows; built admin analytics for revenue, engagement, and content; delivered Softr frontend (dashboard, directory, courses, replays, newsletter, profile, admin) backed by Airtable (Users, Subscriptions, Courses, Replays, Engagement, Newsletter).
body:
Outcomes

  • Centralized analytics for revenue, engagement, content
  • Cleaner site IA and community flows
  • Email automations tied to events
diagram:
graph TD
  subgraph Frontend (Modules)
    DASH[Dashboard] -- views --> DATA
    DIR[Directory] -- views --> DATA
    COURSES[Courses] -- views --> DATA
    REPLAYS[Replays] -- views --> DATA
    NEWS[Newsletter] -- views --> DATA
    PROFILE[Profile] -- updates --> DATA
    ADMIN[Admin] -- manages --> DATA
  end
  subgraph Backend (Airtable)
    DATA[(Users, Subs, Courses, Replays, Engagement, Newsletter)]
  end
  DATA --> EMAIL[Email Automations]
  DATA --> ANALYTICS[Analytics]

title: Mac Assistant — Local AI Automation
summary: A local, privacy‑first macOS menu bar assistant for quick actions: launch apps, file search, summaries, email drafts, and scripted workflows. Uses on‑device models when possible with pluggable tools for calendar, notes, and shell commands.
body:
Capabilities

  • Launch apps, file search, quick summaries
  • Email drafts and notes
  • Scripted workflows with tools
diagram:
graph TD
  MB[macOS Menu Bar] --> ROUTER[Intent Router]
  ROUTER --> LLM[Local Model]
  ROUTER --> TOOLS[Tools]
  TOOLS --> APPS[Apps]
  TOOLS --> FILES[Files]
  TOOLS --> MAIL[Email]
  LLM -. on-device .-> MB

title: Client D — Artist Portfolio & Archive System
summary: Custom responsive portfolio with gallery system, image metadata, categorization, contact/booking forms with backend storage and notifications, and optional e‑commerce for direct sales.
body:
Outcomes

  • Searchable archive with metadata
  • Simple contact/booking funnel
  • Optional direct sales
diagram:
graph TD
  SITE[Portfolio Site] --> GALLERY[Gallery]
  GALLERY --> META[Metadata]
  SITE --> CONTACT[Contact & Booking]
  SITE -. optional .-> SHOP[E‑commerce]

title: Client C — Fitness Operations Automation
summary: Replaced manual e‑transfers and Canva invoices with integrated payments, scheduling, and CRM. Standardized onboarding and reduced admin overhead.
body:
Outcomes

  • Integrated payments and scheduling
  • Standardized onboarding
  • Reduced admin overhead
diagram:
graph TD
  SITE[Website] --> FORM[Intake Form]
  FORM --> CRM[CRM]
  CRM --> SCHED[Scheduling]
  CRM --> PAY[Payments]
  PAY --> RECEIPTS[Receipts]
  CRM --> EMAIL[Notifications]

title: SaaS Business Process Architecture
summary: Business process architecture for SaaS operations.
body:
Scope

  • End‑to‑end process mapping
  • System boundaries & contracts
  • Event flows and data models
diagram:
graph TD
  USERS --> UI[App UI]
  UI --> API[Typed API]
  API --> SVC[Services]
  SVC --> DB[(Data Stores)]
  SVC --> EVENTS[(Events)]
  EVENTS --> ANALYTICS[Analytics]

title: SaaS Workflow Design
body:
Scope

  • Workflow diagrams
  • Background jobs and schedulers
  • Observability and runbooks
diagram:
graph TD
  TRIG[Triggers] --> JOBS[Jobs]
  JOBS --> QUEUE[Queue]
  QUEUE --> WORKERS[Workers]
  WORKERS --> DB[(DB)]
  WORKERS --> METRICS[Metrics]
